item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Only if we are secure in our beliefs can we see the comical side of the universe." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "People without hope not only don't write novels, but what is more to the point, they don't read them." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She would of been a good woman," said The Misfit, "if it had been somebody there to shoot her every minute of her life." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The Catholic novelist in the South will see many distorted images of Christ, but he will certainly feel that a distorted image of Christ is better than no image at all. I think he will feel a good deal more kinship with backwoods prophets and shouting fundamentalists than he will with those politer elements for whom the supernatural is an embarrassment and for whom religion has become a department of sociology or culture or personality development." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Anything that comes out of the South is going to be called grotesque by the northern reader, unless it is grotesque, in which case it is going to be called realistic." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O' Connor
item.description: "Where you come from is gone, where you thought you were going to never was there, and where you are is no good unless you can get away from it" -- Flannery O' Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life and this is a softness that ends in bitterness." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I think it is safe to say that while the South is hardly Christ-centered, it is most certainly Christ-haunted." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Faith is what someone knows to be true, whether they believe it or not." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "When there is a tendency to compartmentalize the spiritual and make it resident in a certain type of life only, the spiritual is apt gradually to be lost." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Tennessee's a hillbilly dumping ground, and Georgia's a lousy state too." -- Flannery O'Connor
